summary: This document is an email chain from August 7, 2019, between a sender and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The sender provides contact information for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who was molested starting at age 14 in Florida and received gifts of lingerie from Epstein. The prosecutor's office indicates they have had difficulty contacting this victim and are seeking to arrange a meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the pending prosecution by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York; his victim is discussed in the correspondence.

events.title: Report of abuse and gifts to victim
events.description: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein was repeatedly molested in Florida starting at age 14 and received multiple gifts of lingerie from Epstein shipped to her in Florida from New York.

events.title: Prosecutor outreach regarding victim interview
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York emails about having difficulty contacting a victim in their investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and seeks to arrange a meeting, offering to travel to Florida.

keyFacts: The document reveals a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who was molested starting at age 14 in Florida.
The victim received multiple gifts of lingerie from Epstein, shipped from New York to Florida.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively trying to contact this victim for an interview in August 2019 as part of their Epstein investigation.
The correspondence indicates the victim was willing to speak to investigators.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
